intro: Theresia, commonly known as the star of Borneo, is a rare and striking plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that resemble stars, with vibrant colors ranging from white to deep red. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its delicate, waxy petals and intricate floral structure. Theresia thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires specific conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in botanical collections and conservation efforts.
